minecolonies.config.commands.comment: All configurations related to the MineColonies commands
minecolonies.config.diseasemodifier.comm: How common diseases are. 1 = Very common, 100 = extremely rare. [Default: 5]
minecolonies.config.diseases.comment: All diseases citizens can get. The name, how common it is, and all ingredients to cure it.
minecolonies.config.generatesupplyloot.c: Whether to generate supply ship/camps in chests occasionally. [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.listofplantables.com: The items and item-tags that the Florist can plant.
item.minecolonies.scepterlumberjack.name: Forester-scepter
item.minecolonies.scepterlumberjack.rest: Area %s is too large. Maximum restricted area for the Forester is %s blocks.
Forester restricted area set. Size is %s blocks. Max size is %s blocks.
minecolonies.config.names.comment: All configuration items related to the citizen names
minecolonies.config.usemiddleinitial.com: Should citizens have a middle initial?
minecolonies.config.malefirstnames.comme: Male first names to be used for colonists
minecolonies.config.femalefirstnames.com: Female first names to be used for colonists
minecolonies.config.lastnames.comment: Last names to be used for colonists
minecolonies.config.builderplaceconstruc: Should the Builder place construction tape? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.playergetsguidebooko: Should a player get one guidebook on their first join to a new world? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.allowinfinitesupplyc: Should players be able to place an infinite amount of supply camps/ships? [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.allowinfinitecolonie: Should players be allowed to abandon their colony to create a new one easily? Note: This is buggy! [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.allowotherdimcolonie: Should colonies in other dimensions be allowed? Note: This is buggy if the dimension doesn't have day/night! [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.builderinfiniteresou: Should the Builder and Miner build without resources? (This also turns off what they produce.) [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.limittoonewarehousep: Should there be a max of 1 warehouse per colony?. [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.builderbuildblockdel: Delay after each block placement (increasing it increases the delay). [Default: 15]
minecolonies.config.blockminingdelaymodi: Delay modifier to mine a block (decreasing it decreases the delay). [Default: 500]
minecolonies.config.maxblockscheckedbybu: Amount of blocks the Builder checks (to decrease lag). [Default: 1000]
minecolonies.config.enableindevelopmentf: Should development features be enabled (might be buggy). [Default: false]
Should citizen name tags be rendered? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.growthmodifier.comme: Child growth modifier. On average children take about 60min to grow at 1.0x modifier (the default). 5 = 5x as fast. [Default: 1]
minecolonies.config.workersalwaysworkinr: Should workers work during the rain? [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.sendenteringleavingm: Should players be sent entering/leaving colony notifications? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.allowplayerschematic: Should player-made schematics be allowed [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.allowglobalnamechang: Should players be allowed to change names? -1 for false, 0 for specific groups, 1 for true. [Default: 1]
minecolonies.config.holidayfeatures.comm: Should special holiday content be displayed? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.updaterate.comment: AI Update rate. Increase this to improve performance. This throttles citizen updates. [Default: 1]
minecolonies.config.dirtfromcompost.comm: Quantity of dirt per compost filling. [Default: 1]
minecolonies.config.luckyblockchance.com: Chance to get a lucky block as a percentage. [Default: 1]
minecolonies.config.fixorphanedchunks.co: Automatically fix orphaned chunks which were caused by chunk loading and saving issues. [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.restrictbuilderunder: Should the Builder be slower when working underground? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.fisherspongechance.c: Chance to get a sponge from the Fisher (starting at hut level 4). [Default: 0.1]
minecolonies.config.fisherprismarinechan: Chance to get a prismarine shard or crystal drop from the Fisher (starting at hut level 3). Overall chance of prismarine is 2x this number [Default: 2.5]
minecolonies.config.minthleveltoteleport: The minimum level a Town Hall has to be to allow teleportation to allied colonies. [Default: 3]
minecolonies.config.suggestbuildtoolplac: Suggest building tool usage when trying to place a building without the building tool. [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.teleportbuffer.comme: Time until a next teleport (to a colony) can be executed in seconds. [Default: 120]
minecolonies.config.oplevelforserver.com: Which level counts as OP on a server. [Default: 3]
minecolonies.config.autodeletecoloniesin: Sets the amount of hours until a colony will be deleted after not seeing its governor. Set to zero to disable this. [Default: 0]
minecolonies.config.autodestroycolonyblo: Sets whether or not colony structures are destroyed automatically when a colony is deleted. [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.canplayerusertpcomma: Can a Player use RTP Command
Should a player be allowed to use the /mc rtp command? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.canplayerusecolonytp: Can a Player use Colony TP Command
Should a player be allowed to use the /mc colony teleport command? [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseallytown: Can a Player TP to Allies
Can a player teleport to allied colonies? [Default:true]
minecolonies.config.canplayerusehometpco: Can a Player use Home TP Command
Should a player be allowed to use the /mc home command? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.canplayerusecitizeni: Can a Player use Citizen Info Command
Should a player be allowed to use the /mc citizens info command? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.canplayeruselistciti: Can a Player use List Citizens Command
Should the player be allowed to use the /mc citizens list command? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseshowcolo: Can a Player use Show Colony Info Command
Should the player be allowed to use the /mc colony info command? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.canplayerusekillciti: Can a Player use Kill Citizens Command
Should the player be allowed to use the /mc citizens kill command? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseaddoffic: Can a Player use Add Officer Command
Should the player be allowed to use the /mc colony addOfficer command? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.canplayerusedeleteco: Can a Player use Delete Colony Command
Should the player be allowed to use the /mc colony delete command? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.numberofattemptsfors: Number of Attempts for Safe TP
Amount of attempts to find a save RTP. [Default: 4]
minecolonies.config.maxColonySize.commen: Maximum claim range (in chunks) for a colony. [Default: 20]
minecolonies.config.minColonyDistance.co: The minimum distance (in chunks) between colonies. [Default: 8]
minecolonies.config.initialColonySize.co: Initial colony claim size in chunks (square shape.) [Default: 4]
minecolonies.config.restrictcolonyplacem: Should the min/max distance from spawn also affect colony placement? [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.enabledynamiccolonys: Should colonies have a fixed radius or should it be dynamic? [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.maxdistancefromworld: Max distance (in blocks) from world spawn for a colony. [Default: 8000]
minecolonies.config.mindistancefromworld: Min distance (in blocks) from world spawn for a colony. [Default: 512]
minecolonies.config.protectvillages.comm: Should players be allowed to build their colonies over existing (vanilla) villages? [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.dobarbariansspawn.co: Whether or not to spawn barbarians. [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.spawnbarbariansize.c: The min size of a barbarian horde. [Default: 5]
minecolonies.config.maxbarbariansize.com: The max size of a barbarian horde. [Default: 20]
minecolonies.config.dobarbariansbreakthr: Whether or not barbarians can break, scale, and bridge obstacles. [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.averagenumberofnight: Average Number of Nights Between Raids
The average number of nights between raids. [Default: 3]
minecolonies.config.minimumnumberofnight: Minimum Number of Nights Between Raids
The minimum number of nights between raids. [Default: 1]
Should citizens call guards for help when attacked? [Default:true]
minecolonies.config.rangerenchants.comme: Should Archer Guards benefit from Power/Punch/Flame enchants (on bows)? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.pvp_mode.comment: Turn on MineColonies pvp mode (colonies can be destroyed and griefed under certain conditions). [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.daysuntilpirateships: Days until the pirate ships despawn. [Default: 3]
minecolonies.config.maxyforbarbarians.co: Max Y level (height) for Barbarians to spawn. [Default: 200]
minecolonies.config.enablecolonyprotecti: Should colony protection be enabled? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.turnoffexplosionsinc: Independent from the colony protection, should explosions be turned off inside colonies? [Default: true]
minecolonies.config.specialpergroup.comm: Players who have special permission (Patreons for example)
minecolonies.config.freetointeractblocks: Blocks players should be able to interact with in any colony (ex: vending machines)
minecolonies.config.dynamictreeharvestsi: Forester harvest trunk size for dynamic trees: 1-8. [Default: 5]
minecolonies.config.pathfindingdebugdraw: Show pathfinding paths (might be laggy). [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.minimumRailsToPath.c: Minimum number of consecutive rails for citizens to use them. [Default: 5]
minecolonies.config.pathfindingmaxthread: Amount of additional threads to be used for pathfinding. [Default: 2]
Max amount of nodes (positions) to map during pathfinding. Lowering increases performance, but might lead to pathing glitches. [Default: 5000]
minecolonies.config.enabledebuglogging.c: Should the request system show debug information? Useful if malfunctioning. [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.maximalretries.comme: The maximal amount of tries that the request system will perform for retryable requests. Higher increases server load. [Default: 3]
The amount of ticks between retries of the request system for retryable requests. Lower increases server load. [Default: 1200]
minecolonies.config.maximalbuildingstoga: The maximal amount of buildings the Courier should try to gather from before attempting a drop off at the warehouse. [Default: 6]
minecolonies.config.minimalbuildingstoga: The minimal amount of buildings the Courier should try to gather from before attempting a drop off at the warehouse. [Default: 3]
minecolonies.config.creativeresolve.comm: Should the request system creatively resolve (if possible) when the player is required to resolve a request. [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.canplayeruseresetcom: Can a Player use Reset Command
Should a player be allowed to use the /mc colony rs reset command? [Default: false]

com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.suppli: §6 Welcome to MineColonies. Now that you have your supplies, how about searching a nice location to place your Town Hall to create your colony...though far away from a vanilla village, if possible.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.colony: §6 Word is out about a newly founded colony. Soon the first settlers will join your colony, if there is enough space around the Town Hall. (Experienced governors can turn off these helpful messages in the Town Hall block.)
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.first_: §6 The first settler arrived at your colony! You should place a Builder's Hut to start your settlement.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.builde: §6 Great job on the placement of the Builder's Hut! However, that's not enough. You need to access it and click the Build Building button! Soon your citizen will be creating new structures for the village.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.built_: §6 While your Builder is working, you can check on the resources he needs on the second page of the building GUI.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.builde: §6 With the Builder's Hut completed, we should turn our attention to resource production. Perhaps you should get a Forester or Miner and a Tavern to house your citizens.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.resour: §6 Producing resources costs energy and makes your settlers hungry. You might want to build a Farm, Fisher's Hut, or animal herder's hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.food_p: §6 Your town starts to flourish! To improve the productivity, you might want to upgrade the buildings.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.four_c: §6 All your initial settlers are now employed. To attract more settlers, you have to build or upgrade housing for them.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.all_ci: §6 I see all your settlers have a nice home now. Build more Houses to get more settlers!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.four_c: §6 The last initial citizen arrived at your colony. To spawn new children, build a House and assign a male and female citizen to it.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.seven_: §6 A new settler arrived at your colony, and they bring word that barbarian spies have found the growing village. You might want to build a Guard Tower!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.six_ci: §6 A growing settlement means a growing responsibility. You should consider placing a Restaurant to keep your settlers well fed.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.eight_: §6 Your citizens urge you to build a Warehouse. This will lighten your backpack, and they may get their materials faster!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.wareho: §6 You've built a Warehouse. However, your people are too tasked as it is to fill it. Build some Courier's Huts to hire Couriers. Up to 2 can work per Warehouse level.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.nine_c: §6 Settlers are saying that their skills influence their leveling speed. You can manually employ citizens, if it is turned on in the Town Hall settings. The best skills for the job will be highlighted during the employment process.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.manual: §6 Workers are complaining about a long walk to their work. You can manually assign them to the closest houses, if the option is turned on in the Town Hall settings.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.ten_ci: §6 A growing colony increases the burdens on your settlers. You should consider upgrading your work huts.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.twenty: §6 A barbarian spy had been caught next to your colony, and he seems to be from a bigger group! You should consider building Barracks to defend your colony.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.not_en: §6 Building more Houses than available jobs has a bad influence on your citizens' happiness.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.newchi: §6 A new child is now happily living in your colony!

com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.hireci: §6 Your recruitment package was accepted and a new citizen arrived!

advancements.minecolonies.root.title: MineColonies
advancements.minecolonies.root.descripti: Start off MineColonies by crafting a Supply Camp or Ship and placing it via right-clicking it on the ground. This will open up the MineColonies Advancements tab!
advancements.minecolonies.place_townhall: Now's the time to start your colony. Grab that build tool and Town Hall block and find a nice, clear area. Then right-click with the build tool to select the style you want, where you want it, and other nifty things!
advancements.minecolonies.create_build_r: Great, you've started your colony! To start building your colony up, you need to craft and place a Builder's Hut (use the build tool again), hire a Builder (automatic by default), and then tell them to build their hut!
advancements.minecolonies.click_gui_butt: Now that you've told your Builder what to do, check out their Requests tab to see what resources or tools they need and fulfill one by clicking the fulfill button!
advancements.minecolonies.citizen_eat_fo: Citizens, much like you, need to eat to be able to work. Put some food in your citizens' inventories and they'll eat it when they need to!
advancements.minecolonies.building_add_r: You're probably going to get sick of having to craft everything for your workers. You can teach your Builder 2x2 recipes, go ahead and teach them how to craft a torch!
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Build the Builder's Hut
If you keep your Builder fed and fulfill their requests, they should start and finish building your first hut!
advancements.minecolonies.citizen_eat_fo: So this is what kind of leader you are, feeding your citizens rotten flesh? Shame, shame, shame!
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Build the Forester's Hut
Now that you've got an awesome Builder, you're going to want to start gathering wood for more huts! Complete building a Forester's Hut (don't forget to use your build tool to place it).
Build the Mine
No doubt you're wanting to get some of those ores and cobble for crafting and building with! Complete building a Mine (again, don't forget to use your build tool to place it).
Build Protection

Once you have 7 citizens in your colony, other entities might take notice of your growing town. Make sure to build a Guard Tower (don't forget to use your build tool to place it) and hire a Guard to protect against these creatures!
Build a Farm
To get started with some good food production for your citizens, you're going to want to build a Farm. You'll also want to place down a Field (scarecrow) to mark where your Farmer will farm.
Home Sweet Home
Your citizens need a place to live! Build them a House, each level houses one citizen.
Lone Settlement
Your citizens need a roof over their heads! Build a Tavern for some initial housing. You can also recruit citizens there!
The Centerpiece

Once you've got your colony set up nicely with a good flow of resources, you might want to think about building your Town Hall. There are only a couple benefits of this currently, but it's a cool centerpiece!
advancements.minecolonies.colony_populat: You're going to need to get more citizens if you want to get things done! Children will be born when two citizens of opposite gender are in the same house during the night. Children need to be fed and sleep well to grow up.
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Storage
I'm sure at this point you're wanting to start automating stuff, right? Well, first you've got to place and build a Warehouse to store all those materials in a central location!
Requesting Items
Now that you've got a good central storage location, let's start automatically answering citizen requests! Build a Courier's Hut and hire a Courier for them to fulfill worker requests.
Crafting Wood!
With the Courier by your side, you can start using crafting workers! We recommend starting off with the Sawmill, place and build one to start your crafting experience!
advancements.minecolonies.building_add_r: Now that you've unlocked 3x3 crafting with your Sawmill, teach your new Carpenter to craft a door! Note: Crafters will only craft when another worker requests something and have a limit on what they can craft. See the info tab in their hut for more.
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Such a Stoner
A Stonemason can craft 3x3 recipes using stone as their main ingredient, build one to take advantage of their skill!
Smelt that Ore!
Smeltery workers are pretty awesome, they'll smelt your ores for you! And at higher levels they can get pretty efficient...
It's Getting Hot in Here!
For your Stonemason to make stone bricks and things like that, you're going to need some stone! Place and build a Stone Smeltery to automate the creation of stone and more!
Get Baked
Your citizens need some carbs in their lives, build a Bakery so the Baker can craft baked goods for them!
Good ol' Smithy
Most citizens need some form of tool, and crafting those can be a very specialised process. Build the Blacksmith's Hut to allow automated crafting of tools!
Building an Army
If you really want to protect your colony, you're going to need a whole lot more Guards. Building a Barracks will allow you to hire a lot more in a much smaller space!
Beautiful Towers
Now that you've got your Barracks, you need to build the Barracks Towers inside it. These towers are locked to the same level as the Barracks and will increase their max guards every level!
A Poultry Sum of Meat
Taking Knight Classes

If you want to truly protect your citizens you're going to need well-trained Knights. Build a Combat Academy and assign a citizen to it to increase their Guard level without the risk of losing their life!
Fertile Lands
A Composter will take your leftover saplings, leaves, and like items and expose them to the elements. Doing this will produce fertilizer for your crops!
Feeding the Masses
Building a Restaurant will give your citizens a place to get food, the Cook will cook meats and give food to your citizens and you!
Yeeeehaww!
Build a Cowhand's Hut to bring in that beef, remember you'll need to bring the cows to your Cowhand for them to be usable!
I'm Crushed
Building a Crusher's Hut will enable you to get things like gravel from cobblestone!
Something Smells Fishy
Build a Fisher's Hut close to water to bring in those deep sea morsels
Higher Learning
If you want more skilled labor, you'd best build a Library to teach your citizens!
Mary had a Little Lamb
Sometimes you really need some soft wool in your life. Build a Shepherd's Hut to take advantage of those poor unsuspecting sheep!
Diamond in the Rough
Sometimes you'll find goodies inside random blocks. Build a Sifter's Hut to take advantage of that!
Getting the Bacon
Nobody can resist bacon, build a Swineherd's Hut so your citizens don't miss out!
Level Up!
In order to upgrade other huts beyond level 1, you'll need to have a Builder's Hut that's been upgraded!
advancements.minecolonies.colony_populat: 10 Citizens means more workers, and more workers means more resources!
25 Citizens is a lot, hopefully you're keeping them alive!
50 Citizens is enough to have more than 1 of every worker, wow!
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Double Trouble!
A level 3 Smeltery has a 100% chance of doubling ore output, nice!
Ore Tripling
A level 5 Smeltery has a chance of tripling every ore output, the chance is equal to the worker's level!
A Building to Be Proud Of
While there's not a lot of benefit to having a level 5 Town Hall, it sure does look pretty! (And it got you this advancement!)
Bullseye
While Knights are pretty great, they're even better when they've got backup in the form of Archers. Better train those at an Archery!
Floral Arrangements
The Flower Shop will use compost or other types of "bonemeal" to grow you all those pesky flowers your buildings tend to want!
Enchanting Experience
The Enchanter's Tower will consume ancient tomes and other workers' experience to produce enchanted books for your personal usage!

com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.0:
The Builder is the heart of your colony. Without them, you wouldn't be able to get anything done!
 Every hut worker has to have their building built to at least level 1 before they can do anything, except the Builder. If the Builder has a hut at level 0 (no hut), they can only build one thing, their own hut.

 For your Builder to build, upgrade, reposition, or repair a hut that isn't their own, their hut must be at least the same level as the other hut. For example, the Builder's Hut must be level 3 or above to build a level 3 hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.1:
Let's cover builder restrictions:

 1. Builders (and most other workers) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Builders have a maximum range of 100 blocks for buildings for automatic assignment. If your building is outside that range, in the top right of the build options GUI (for the hut you want to be built) you can select which Builder to assign to that building.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. I'm seeing an item in the required resources page that seems unobtainable or requires Silk Touch to get. What should I do?
   A 1. Things like Air, Dirt Paths, and other blocks will show up in the required resources tab from time to time. While they do show up, focus mainly on your Builder's personal request tab. They'll usually request the correct block and convert it accordingly (e.g. request Dirt and then use a shovel on it).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.3:
As all workers do, the Builder levels up while working.
 At higher levels, the Builder's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.0: The House is where your citizens will live. For every level of the House, the building will house one citizen. You will need multiple houses to house everyone. The only citizens that will not live in a House are your Guards.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.1: In order to have children, a male and a female citizen must be housed together in one House. Even if you don't have room in the same hut as them, as long as there is an open bed in any House or Tavern within the colony, a child can be born. If there is an adult in another house, the child will be adopted by them, taking on the last name of that adult. If there is a hut with no adult in it, the child will get a random name.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.2: Workers have their level capped by the level of their House. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.0: The Miner is one of the production workers for your colony. They will need an pickaxe to mine stone, a shovel to mine dirt and gravel, and sometimes even an axe if they run into a mineshaft. They will also need supplies to build their own mineshafts, such as blocks, slabs, fences/walls, signs, ladders, and torches.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.1:
Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Miners unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How far down will my miner dig before making nodes?
   A 1. Without intervention, at level 1 they will build nodes after they hit y level 50, at level 2 they will make nodes after they hit y level 30, and at level 3 they will make nodes after they hit y level 5.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.3:
Q2. My Miner just stops working or wanders around above ground, why?
  A 2. Either something is blocking their path or they don't have the necessary materials. See page 1 for the materials they need or check the Miner's request page.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.4:
As all workers do, Miners level up while working.
 At higher levels, the Miner's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack:
The Forester is one of the production workers for your colony. Give them an axe and they'll cut down any trees around them. They'll also replant a sapling where the tree was if he has any.
 If you wish to apply restrictions on what trees they can or can't cut, take a look at the second page.
 Even cooler is the third page. Here you can tell the Forester to not replant saplings and tell them to be restricted to a certain area (selected with the tool given by the third button on the page).

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Foresters unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Foresters are able to search for trees within 150 blocks of them (not their hut). While searching, they start with a 50 block range and then increase that range by 5 if they do not find a tree.

3. The definition of a "Tree" in Minecraft is pretty hazy at best. We've done our best to define a tree, but in some cases it may not be enough. Generally we define a tree as a log and leaves (near each other), due to this some of your huts or decorations may be affected by the Forester, to counter this you can place a piece of Cobblestone below a log to mark it as "not a tree".

As all workers do, Foresters level up while working.
 At higher levels, the Forester's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Warehouse is part of colony management. It's where all of your excess supplies are stored. There are no workers assigned to the Warehouse, but Couriers use the Warehouse.

Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Space is limited to the number of racks in the schematic and you can not add your own. If you do, they will get destroyed when the building is updated and the Couriers will not see/use those racks. You also cannot move the racks already in the building. If you break a rack, it is no longer seen by the Couriers.

3. Now let's cover some frequently asked questions: 

 Q 1. I need more storage space that is given, how do I get more? 
 A 1. Upgrade the building. If the building is level 5, you can increase the space in each rack by buying more on page 2 of the GUI using an emerald block. This can be done 3 times.

Q 2. I want to move my Warehouse, can I do that? 
 A 2. You can, but if there is anything in the racks, the contents will spill out when the racks are removed by the Builder. If you must move the Warehouse, remove all the contents from the racks first, and watch to make sure any Couriers don't deliver items.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryma: Couriers are part of colony management. They are the transportation service of the colony and will pick up unneeded items from worker huts and drop them at the Warehouse, as well as gather needed items from the Warehouse and deliver them to workers.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 The number of stacks a Courier can carry at a time depends on their hut level. 
 Level 1: 1 Stack 
 Level 2: 2 Stacks 
 Level 3: 4 Stacks 
 Level 4: 8 Stacks 
 Level 5: unlimited stacks (that can still fit in their inventory)

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How do I change the priority of who the Couriers pickup from?
   A 1. In each hut, there is a pickup priority setting. 1 is the lowest, 10 is the highest, and there's also never (no items will ever be picked up).

 Q 2. Can I change the delivery priority?
 A 2. No, the delivery schedule is determined by order the request is sent.

As all workers do, Couriers level up while working.
 At higher levels, a Courier's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.0:
The Cook is part of the food production of your colony. The Cook supplies all your citizens with food and will cook meat and potatoes, as well as other cooked food that only needs a furnace.
 When a citizen gets hungry, they will go to the Cook to get something to eat.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.1:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. The Cook is asking for items that are already cooked, is this normal?
   A 1. You can provide pre-cooked items for the Cook to distribute to your colonists.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.2:
As all workers do, the Cook levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Cook's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.0: The Baker is part of the food production of your colony. They will bake bread, cookies, pumpkin pie, and/or cake. On page two of the Bakery GUI, you can select which items you want them to make.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.1: The Baker cannot make any food with items that are not consumed in the making like pots and pans. These are usually from mods like Pam's.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Baker is using more items than they are producing, why?
   A 1. The Baker may be consuming some product when they get hungry. Also, while the wheat/other ingredients may not be visible, the product may still be in the process of being produced.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.3:
As all workers do, the Baker levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Baker's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.0: The Farmer is part of the food production of your colony. The Farmer grows crops for the colony. The Farmer can plant and harvest any crop that is planted in farmland, even from other mods.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.1:
Farmers unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Farmers cannot grow plants that do not use farm land, such as sugar cane, cactus, or bamboo. These are grown by the Planter instead.
 Farmers can only maintain one field per their hut level.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. I want a smaller field, how do I tell my Farmer not to grow crops up to the maximum size? 
   A 1. Use the Field GUI to set the size of the field.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.3:
As all workers do, the Farmer levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Farmer's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Fisher is part of the food production of your colony. Simply put, the Fisher will fish as long as you provide them with a fishing rod and a big enough area of water.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. The Fisher needs a body of water at least seven blocks by seven blocks and at least one block deep. The hut block must be at the same level as the water and must be <= ten blocks from the water.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Fisher is catching more than just fish, why?
   A 1. The Fishermen can catch other items, same as a player can.

As all workers do, the Fisher levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Fisher's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.chickenher: The Chicken Farmer is part of the food production of your colony. The Chicken Farmer breeds, raises, and butchers chickens. They will collect eggs, feathers, and meat, as well as any drops from other mods. The Chicken Farmer will keep two chickens alive per level of their hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Chicken Farmers unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two chickens must be provided for the Chicken Farmer to start breeding and butchering.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Chicken Farmer need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two chickens to get things started. The Chicken Farmer also needs seeds to breed the chickens and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers do, the Chicken Farmer levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Chicken Farmer's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.swineherde: The Swineherd is part of the food production of your colony. The Swineherd breeds, raises, and butchers pigs. They will collect the meat, as well as any drops from other mods. The Swineherd will keep two pigs alive per level of their hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Swineherds unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two pigs must be provided for the Swineherd to start breeding and butchering.

 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.0: The Shepherd is part of the food production of your colony. The Shepherd breeds, raises, shears, and butchers sheep. They will collect the meat and wool, as well as any drops from other mods. The Shepherd will keep two sheep alive per level of their hut. If you choose, on the second page of the GUI you can tell the Shepherd to randomly dye sheep to get colored wool.

com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.0: The Cowhand is part of the food production of your colony. The Cowhand breeds, raises, and butchers cows. They will collect the meat and leather, as well as any drops from other mods. The Cowhand will keep two cows alive per level of their hut.

The Composter is part of the crafting line of your colony. The Composter will turn items into compost for Farmers and Florists to use.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. You must choose which items you want the Composter to use to make compost with. This is found on page two of the hut GUI. 
   Be careful using food items if you have a large colony but not many food production huts!

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I use items from other mods?
   A 1. Yes, but these must be added in the MineColonies configuration file. This is found in (your instance folder)/config/minecolonies-common.toml.

As all workers do, the Composter levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Composter's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.guardtower:
The Guard Tower is the basic hut for your military defense. Each Guard Tower employs one Guard. However, the Guard will also live in the tower, freeing up a bed for more citizens.
There are two different types of Guards, Knights and Archers. Knights use swords, while Archers use bows.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Guards unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Guard Tower was leveled up, but the Guard isn't asking for higher level equipment. Why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers do, the Guard levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Guard's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracksto:
The Barracks Tower is the heart of your military defense. Each Barracks Tower employs 1 Guard per level for a total of 5. However, the Guards will also live in the tower, freeing up beds for more citizens.
There are two different types of Guards, Knights and Archers. Knights use swords, while Archers use bows.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Guards unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Barracks Tower was leveled up, but the Guards aren't asking for higher level equipment. Why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers do, the Guards level up while working.
 At higher levels, a Guard's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.0:
The Barracks is the heart of your military defense. Without it you wouldn't be able to build any Barracks Towers!
 Each Barracks contains four Barracks Towers, one for each level (up to level four).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Barracks only hold 1 Barracks Tower per level, and each tower can only level as high as the Barracks. So if you have a level 1 Barracks, it will only allow 1 Barracks Tower with a max level of 1. If you have a level 3 Barracks, it will allow 3 Barracks Towers with a max level of 3.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I have more than 1 Barracks?
   A 1. Yes, but the Barracks Tower levels are based on the Barracks they are attached to. So even if you have one Barracks that is level 5, if the second Barracks is only level 1, then that Barracks can only have a single level 1 tower.
